review.comment_positive: This was a beautiful hotel. The front desk was exceptionally helpful with all of our needs and always available to help. The rooms were beautifully designed and very clean. Itâ€™s in quiet location. The pool area was gorgeous and open concept with a steam room. Staying at Orchids Saigon Hotel  for one night is a luxury we thoroughly enjoyed.
review.comment_negative: We might have liked to stay in a slightly more lively location but  this was a great oasis from walking street area and it was close by.

review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Deluxe GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i NhÃ¬n Ra ThÃ nh Phá»‘
review.comment_positive:
Friendly and helpful staff. The room was comfortable with good facilities. Location very good and able to walk to most attractions. 
I would stay again regardless of the issues raised below.
review.comment_negative:
Breakfast was limited for westerners. Bacon arrived only once during our 7 day stay. Chef provided eggs any way which was good. Could try some baked beans etc. Toaster basically not functional. 
If you stay at this hotel be prepared to walk and be careful. Motorbikes use the footpaths here as roads and the footpath in front of the hotel is no exception.
The hotel corridors are not air-conditioned and your room is not air conditioned once you leave your room. 
Also the hair dryer failed when we there and we were not offered a replacement.

review.comment_positive: room and bed
review.comment_negative:
Unfortunately, booking.com rating are far from reality for this property, and here is why:
- Breakfast is very poor in this hotel, u can only see few dishes which is mostly dimsum some fried fish and pork sausage with limited selection of fried rice and noodles, and of course Pho. Other than that if u ask to cook fried egg chef lady which never smiles will accept your order by word "Roi" which is a very impolite way of answering. On top of that if u ask to cook 4 eggs they will only fry 2. I have stayed at a dozen of hotels with far worse ratings and all of them provided much better breakfast. 
- Another weird but big negative part is that hotel does not provide you with iron in the room and you cannot even bring it to some hotel rules. 
- And last but not least is the staff at first they are trying their best to accommodate your request and help you but unfortunately they do not have appropriate training all the time u will see them playing on phones sitting on the desk, i never see if they have any front desk manager or even supervisor and whenever i asked if they have they said no. 
- Another terrible experience u will face every time u stay in the hotel is car abundance in front of the hotel doors, i guess it might be the hotel owner or someone else but its all the time crowd of cars in front of the hotel doors, terrible experience to walk through them.

review.comment_negative: We encountered several issues with the hotel's handling of our early check-in request and subsequent room assignment. Despite our willingness to pay an additional fee, the hotel was unable to accommodate our request due to full occupancy. Upon arriving at the designated check-in time of 14:00, we were further inconvenienced when the hotel attempted to provide us with a room of lesser quality than the one we had reserved and paid for through Booking.com. Despite our objections and requests for clarification, the hotel staff insisted that the room was the same as the one we had booked. They also informed us that if we wanted to get the room from the photos, we would need to wait for an hour in the lobby so they could prepare it. No complimentary drinks were offered as an apology for the inconvenience caused. We found this to be a disrespectful and unprofessional way to treat guests.

review.comment_positive: The hotel is wonderful, in an excellent location and the rooms are very clean and tasteful. We had a city view room (the view over Saigon is fantastic), and even though the room was on the front, I didn't notice any noise from the road. Staff was really professional and eager to help we anything we asked. Check-in was super smooth, and despite the fact we had only booked our room in the last minute the night before, everything was ready on time when we arrived.
review.comment_negative: The only minus was that in the first day when we arrived, pool water was so cloudy you couldn't see the bottom, so we didn't want to go in. But even that was resolved the next day and we could enjoy the pool and all the amenities!

review.comment_positive:
- The staff were attentive, friendly and professional. 
- the room was nicely made up
- breakfast buffet had the standard exotic fruits which were lovely. 
- location was decent  - 15-20 min walk to the main walking street, about 8 mins to other attractions too.
- we had an early flight when we checked out and as our breakfast was included, the hotel made us a takeaway breakfast which was nice.
review.comment_negative:
- the breakfast options were limited to more Asian style rather than Western (which is expected of course). 
- our room was on floor 3 and was directly next to a little cafe/restaurant so our only view was that, and that place also had strong neon lights which came through the side of the curtains (I was directly next to the window and so this was in my face). Despite that, we couldn't hear outside so that was a bonus. 
- the pool was nice however was a little on the cold side

review.comment_negative:
Can only really say - trust the other negative reviews that say this place is an utter scam. They really try on the â€˜dirty towelâ€™ scam with every guest that attempts to check out; claiming a towel or sheets are dirty and demanding more money. Saw them harassing two families demanding money before they could check out. I seemingly checked out fine, ordered a Grab to the airport only for an attendant to run out and say I couldnâ€™t leave until they checked and confirmed the.. towels.. of all things, werenâ€™t dirty. Weird. We were fine but the manager was being quite rude to the families. Never seen this before in any hotel really.

Honestly, hotels like this are a dime a dozen in Ho Chi Minh, so better off not to go somewhere that wonâ€™t be waiting to hit you with â€˜additionalâ€™ surprise costs at the end of your stay. Big recommendation to skip this one. 

Also, a bit off for the staff to take photos of your passport on their personal phone..

review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Premium Deluxe GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i/2 GiÆ°á»ng ÄÆ¡n NhÃ¬n ra ThÃ nh phá»‘
review.comment_positive: Well certainly, the bed and shower are the best part of the hotel and I would highly recommend it if u only want to come and sleep.
review.comment_negative:
Unfortunately, booking.com rating are far from reality for this property, and here is why:
- Breakfast is very poor in this hotel, u can only see few dishes which is mostly dimsum some fried fish and pork sausage with limited selection of fried rice and noodles, and of course Pho. Other than that if u ask to cook fried egg chef lady which never smiles will accept your order by word "Roi" which is a very impolite way of answering. On top of that if u ask to cook 4 eggs they will only fry 2. I have stayed at a dozen of hotels with far worse ratings and all of them provided much better breakfast. 
- Another weird but big negative part is that hotel does not provide you with iron in the room and you cannot even bring it to some hotel rules. 
- And last but not least is the staff at first they are trying their best to accommodate your request and help you but unfortunately they do not have appropriate training all the time u will see them playing on phones sitting on the desk, i never see if they have any front desk manager or even supervisor and whenever i asked if they have they said no. 
- Another terrible experience u will face every time u stay in the hotel is car abundance in front of the hotel doors, i guess it might be the hotel owner or someone else but its all the time crowd of cars in front of the hotel doors, terrible experience to walk through them.

review.comment_positive:
The room was excellent. Clean, cool, and comfortable. If you're looking for some peace in the bustle of the city this is it. 

We loved the elevated swimming pool but it was a shame the bar wasn't open there. It could be so much nicer up there if they offered drinks, had some more plants and just made it feel more welcoming. I know it's a 'corporate hotel' but everyone likes a cool beer under some greenery!
review.comment_negative:
These are very minor negatives! 

The breakfast is, despite some of the reviews, focussed on Vietnamese cuisine. I have no problem with this but a more continental offering would have been nice. 

There is a 'beer' garden which is actually just some chairs in the lobby. You can have food and drinks there but we didn't as it really feels like you're just sat in the lobby waiting for a taxi or something.

review.comment_positive: Excellent facility in a ultra-convenient location. The hotel also has a small gym and pool to cool down in the hot weather of Saigon. The room is in modern condition, clean and came with a beautiful restroom I had scheduled visits to the Eye Hospital nearby so this hotel made the perfect option for doctor visits and surgery. However it would be ideal for all tourist and travel workers alike. I can easily access the popular part of the city with a quick walk or taxi ride.
review.comment_negative: Staff was not all friendly (some were and some weren't). I had previously stayed at another hotel in Hanoi where I received a difference experience of friendly staff (with a doorman, smiley faces whenever I see them and they always make conversations with myself and my friend to make sure we had all we need and more) so the variance was rather clear. However, Orchids Hotel Staff were quick with all requests and also happy to let me check out 1 hour later than normal.

review.comment_negative:
I didn't appreciate some of the policies of the hotel: 1. There is no iron in the room and they won't bring it. I called and they told me that they offer it only as a service. 2. I requested a (paid) early check-in and they informed me that it depends on their availability. When they arrived, the receptionist didn't even look at the computer and told me that I would have to come back 3h later to check in even though I had just arrived after a 20h flight. 3. Then, I asked to get breakfast and the receptionist told me that it was already 9.15 and that breakfast is served until 9.30. So, I couldn't even get a cup of tea and a pastry. 

It's a good hotel but I'll go somewhere else next time.

review.comment_positive: It is in a great location near most of the museums, tourist attractions, and parks. There are great breakfast and coffee places near the park few blocks away, but not much good restaurants nearby. The hotel is newish and clean. It is in a quiet area at night. We skipped the hotel breakfast as there are tons of brunch places all over Saigon. Housekeeping are efficient keeping the rooms clean.
review.comment_negative: I requested for extra pillows and they didn't arrive. Guests pay for lost key cards. Poor soundproof. We could clearly hear the other guests in the room and in the hallways. Doors make this loud noise when you close them and with the poor soundproofing, it can be a lot to hear doors closing and opening from other rooms. The pool is terrible. It is small with a tiny lounging areas and it was busy.

review.rating: AVOIS THIS HOTEL AT ALL COSTS !!
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Deluxe GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i NhÃ¬n Ra ThÃ nh Phá»‘
review.comment_positive:
great location, we walked all
round the city from the hotel,
Modern bathroom, Although this flooded the floor with every shower, badly designed and we had to use towels to mop up excess water to avoid slipping
review.comment_negative:
when we were checking out, we were charged 250,000 Vietnamese Dong each for 2 towels that they said were dirty !! They even had photos of said towels !! The marks were from foundation which I owned up too but they said the charge was because they couldnâ€™t get them clean. I was absolutely flabbergasted, I have never in all my years of travelling & staying in hotels around the world been charged for towels, I asked for the towels that I was being charged for (their flimsy quality of these very small barh towels were definitely not worth 250,000 each!!) 
The staff then changed their tune and said the charge was for specialist cleaning â€¦.. again there is no way it would have cost this much as I used to live in Saigon & know the cost of living !!
Essentially this hotel is a total rip off / they were trying all ways to extract money out of us & if I hadnâ€™t been heading to the airport for a flight I would have ask speak to the manager. The reception staff were extremely rude did not bat an eyelid at this shocking charges & I assume this is an expectation passed down from management. 
Having read other reviews there are other guests with similar experiences & extra charges being demanded !
AVOID THIS HOTEL AT ALL COSTS !!!

review.rating: Good Hotel, but ridiculous checkout policies ruin the experience
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Suite GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i/2 GiÆ°á»ng ÄÆ¡n Vá»›i Bá»ƒ Jacuzzi VÃ  Táº§m NhÃ¬n Ra ThÃ nh Phá»‘
review.comment_positive: friendly staff and good location. Rooms are clean and in a good condition
review.comment_negative:
unfortunately, the checkout policy is ridiculous. We had a suit in the hotel and upon checkout we were presented with a towel and a pillow sheet which good a bit dirty. The hotel staff made a big fuzz about this minor issue and demanded we compensate the hotel for the damage. Initially, they asked for 900.000 Dong which is half the roommate per night almost. So absolute ridiculous pricing which I have never experienced before. We explained them that the stains can be removed by washing as we have the same stains caused by the hair color at home but never have any issues. This checkout policy has ruined the entire hotel experience. Additionally, the pricing which was asked for seems like a cheap way to get additional money and to replace older towels or sheets on the expense of the customer. We refused to pay after a discussion of 20min. I have never ever experienced something like this before.
As other hotels in the city have a similar value offering but do not have such ridiculous policies I would recommend staying elsewhere

review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Deluxe GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i NhÃ¬n Ra ThÃ nh Phá»‘
review.comment_positive: Orchids Saigon is a fabulous hotel located in a very good place. You can find a number of dining options around such as Jollibee, The Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf and other restaurants. It's quite close to places like War Remnants Museum, Ho Chi Minh City Museum (walking distance) and just 10 minutes' drive to famous Golden Water Puppet Show Theater. This is a luxurious hotel with wonderful staff service. Breakfast was superb with a varieties of options to choose from. Even if you do not eat pork then they would arrange complimentary vegetable rice for you which was much appreciated. Room was excellent with so many spaces (i.e. drawers) to keep your belongings. Bathroom was quite cozy, comfortable with a high-tech toilet. They do have a decent swimming pool which is spacious enough to swim and relax. We would love to stay again in future.
review.comment_negative: Nothing particular, however, their breakfast finishing time seemed a bit earlier than usual (most probably 6:30 am to 9:30 am) which could be extended till 10 am. In addition, it's better to have glass doors in the shower because their curtain system isn't good enough to keep sprinkles of water from making the bathroom floor a bit wet.

But the question is, SURELY, a hotel of the Orchids chain can store some small number of 200 ml tetra packs of these alternatives, so that lactose intolerant guests have some alternative. review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Premium Deluxe GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i/2 GiÆ°á»ng ÄÆ¡n NhÃ¬n ra ThÃ nh phá»‘
review.comment_positive:
Do I recommend staying in this hotel? Absolutely Yes
- Location: It is located in the heart of the city. Main attractions/historical sites (cathedral, post office, sky deck observatory, etc.) within walking distance from the hotel. There are different restaurants in the area, bars, ATM's, etc. 
- Room: The room was spacious, well equipped (coffee, tea, toiletries, etc.), clean, has a big bathroom, enough storage and comfortable beds. It was bigger than I expected. 
- Facilities/breakfast/hotel: The premises are well maintained, there is a pool where you can refresh and spend some time. The breakfast is amazing, they offer different options (omelets, fruit, yogurt, pastries, local dishes, vegan options, etc.) The food is fresh and tasty
- Staff: The staff was amazing, very friendly and polite. They welcomed us with a delicious cold tea. The staff from the breakfast is very service oriented. They made our staying very pleasant. Check in/out very smooth.

review.comment_positive:
The location of the hotel is good and nearby most of the tourist attractions of Saigon. The staff is courteous but can improve on their communication skills by having more people coversant in English. The breakfast menu was decent but for Indians who like chicken and prefer veggies, it was a bit disappointing. We had to get cup noodles to the room and eat them but then their is a decent Fried Chicken place akin to KFC hardly 200m from the property. So overall a much recommended place to stay for tourists esp from India
 Thank you

review.comment_positive: The hotel was in a great location. It was very clean and comfortable with a good range of breakfast options. The rooms were modern and tasteful with dressing gowns and slippers provide plus great Air Con and a safe in the room.
review.comment_negative: We had a late flight and asked if there was a courtesy room available to shower etc. This was not something offered so we requested a late checkout, offering to pay whatever the cost, expecting a percentage charge. We were told this was not possible as the hotel was fully booked. We then checked online to find another room elsewhere and found multiple rooms were available to book at this hotel. When we showed the staff that we had found availability, they seemed indifferent and told us to book online, using the app. We had checked out of our original room, then had to wait 2hrs to check into the next room. Not the best customer service experience, which was a shame as everything else was really great!

Todas las facilidades que nos han brindado el resto de hoteles de Vietnam (a veces de menos categorÃ­a) aquÃ­ han sido problemas. 
En primer lugar, me puse en contacto con ellos para gestionar el traslado desde el aeropuerto que es un servicio que ofertan y me invitaron a usar la aplicaciÃ³n Grab y coger un taxi. Lo tuve que gestionar yo.
En segundo lugar, solicitÃ© hacer un check out mÃ¡s tarde (pagando obviamente) ya que tenÃ­amos un vuelo internacional y querÃ­amos estar descansados. Me contestaron que era imposible porque el hotel estaba lleno. Inmediatamente, a travÃ©s de Booking reservÃ© una habitaciÃ³n sin problemas (cuando se supone que estaba lleno) pagando el precio completo cuando no voy a disfrutar ni de la noche ni del desayuno incluido. En los otros hoteles nos ofertaron este servicio pagando un 20% a modo simbÃ³lico.
En cuanto a servicios, el desayuno nos ha parecido muy pobre para el gusto occidental. Yo no desayuno ni arroz, ni pollo, ni cerdo, ni noodles.....curioso que en el hall haya una pequeÃ±a cafeterÃ­a donde sÃ­ hay algo de bollerÃ­a con croissant a casi 2 euros. 
Y respecto a laÂ  piscina,Â  una decepciÃ³n que cierre a las 6. Con este calor la gente estÃ¡ deseando llegar de la calle y darse un chapuzÃ³n. En el resto de hoteles estaba abierta hasta las 9 o 10 de la noche.
La verdad es que esperaba mucho mÃ¡s de este hotel. Las fotos muy bonitas pero para mÃ­ no es un 4 estrellas.

Der Vorraum mit Sofa und Liegestuhl lÃ¤dt zum Verweilen ein, gerade wenn mal wieder die Mittags-Sonne brennt.
TÃ¤glich werden die Zimmer top gereinigt, Betten gemacht und die tÃ¤glichen 3 kostenlosen Wasserflaschen erneuert.
Der Raum verfÃ¼gt Ã¼ber 2 separat einstellbare Klimaanlagen.
Ãœber die die beiden TV-GerÃ¤te kann auch auf YouTube und Netflix zugegriffen werden.
Der Pool-Bereich im 9. Stock bietet etwas mehr Platz als bei anderen Hotels der Preisklasse, das Wasser ist tatsÃ¤chlich eine AbkÃ¼hlung, zumal er aber draussen/Ã¼berdacht ist, bietet er die beste Gelegenheit sich an das Klima zu gewÃ¶hnen. Zudem ist eine kleine Dampfsauna vorhanden.
Schliesslich noch das Positive zum FrÃ¼hstÃ¼ck: frisches PhÃ´, frische Eier/Omeletts sowie der vietnamesische Eiskaffee! Letzterer will jedoch bestellt werden, also HÃ¤nde weg von der Kaffee-Kanne!    :)

Weniger Einfluss hat man auf die Temperaturen in den allgemein zugÃ¤nglichen Bereichen (Lobby, AufzÃ¼ge, FrÃ¼hstÃ¼cksraum). Gerade beim FrÃ¼hstÃ¼ck trugen wir jeweils Hoodies um uns vor den zu kÃ¼hl eingestellten Anlagen zu schÃ¼tzen.

review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Premium Deluxe GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i/2 GiÆ°á»ng ÄÆ¡n NhÃ¬n ra ThÃ nh phá»‘
review.comment_positive: Nice view from the room. Large, comfortable bed
review.comment_negative:
The pool shares its floor with the banquet center. Nothing like relaxing on 1 of 6 tightly-packed deck chairs while a DJ tries to pump up a Saturday morning business lunch. Pool itself was freezing, small, and a flat 1.4 meters. 

The shower was my main problem with the room. It is a bathtub with a very cheap shower head. The curtain was extremely thin and did not cover the length, resulting in a lot of water in the slippery floor. The combo of high walled tub and being raised made exiting and exiting very dangerous. I did slip on entry and almost fell. I would not be surprised if many older guests are intimidated by the shower. 

The breakfast buffet was bland and did not have many western choices. No Orange juice or coffee station-just a gas station type pot of black coffee with only sweetened condensed milk as a choice for cream. I was served an omelette made with old eggs. When I told the staff they shrugged and asked if I wanted it cooked more and did not offer a new omelette.

review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Deluxe GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i NhÃ¬n Ra ThÃ nh Phá»‘
review.comment_positive:
+ Location. Easy to reach with the airport bus or taxi, lots of places within walking distance, plenty of restaurants and street food around
+ Very clean rooms
+ Super comfy beds
+ Very good sound isolation. Although our rooms (we stayed 2 times during our 2-week trip) were facing the road, you could barely hear any noise from there
+ Fast and easy WiFi access
+ Pool on the 9th floor with great views
+ Gym
+ Amenity kit (toothbrush, toothpaste, comb, and a bunch more)
+ Japanese style toilet :)
review.comment_negative:
- Very strict check-in time, exactly at 2 pm and not a hour earlier. 
- Breakfast. Although it was quite diverse, taste-wise it wasn't anything special. 
- The carpet in the hallway on the second floor was filthy, with spots and just dirt.

review.comment_positive: The location is perfect, most of the tourist attractions are near to the hotel, walking distance 5-15 minutes. The hotel is surrounded with trees and you won't feel hot while walking on the pedestrian road. Besides, there are few cafÃ© and food stalls can be found near to the hotel. The room is cozy and the soundproof is excellent. Everything in the room is brand new. The breakfast was excellent, I stayed at the hotel for 4 days and I got to tried different dishes every day. review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Suite GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i/2 GiÆ°á»ng ÄÆ¡n Vá»›i Bá»ƒ Jacuzzi VÃ  Táº§m NhÃ¬n Ra ThÃ nh Phá»‘
review.comment_positive:
Nothing unfortunately, had to check out earlier.
Staff was very rude and impolite.
review.comment_negative:
Staff is very rude and impolite.
Pool area can't be use since it is over 40 degrees (104 degrees Fahrenheit).
The gym in not a gym, has no equipment at all.
The bathroom was very dirty.
Had to check out earlier (but did not get an any compensation at all, they just laughed).
This hotel has for sure bought their reviews from other guests.
A disgrace for Vietnam.
This js not a hotel, is a money making machine.

The hotel asked us on the booking chat function why we checked out earlier. We answered below but did not get an answer. 

"We booked your hotel because of the pool area which looks really nice on the pictures you promote and partly for the gym. We arrived at midnight the 4th of January and looked at the pool area the next day. Unfortunately it was too hot go in there and very humid, it can not be used or promoted as a pool area since it is to hot to be there. We directly asked if we could check out some days earlier but didn't get an answer. We then asked again at the evening and was told we would get an answer the next day. We went and asked the next morning at 07.30 am but didn't get an answer. We came back at lunch time and got told that we couldn't check out earlier for different reasons. We then contacted Booking who contacted you, but you have not replied (bad service).  The standard of the room was ok however the shower drain was clogged which lead to the bathroom floor being flooded so we couldn't shower.  We have told the reception several times why we wanted to check out earlier but they don't seem to listen or care.   We told you days in advance that we wanted to check out earlier but you didn't care about that.   The check out process this morning was very bad. It took a very long time and the guy did not even ask a singe question about or stay."

review.rating: A charming hotel with great staff and cozy rooms with tons of closet space
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Superior GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i/2 GiÆ°á»ng ÄÆ¡n
review.comment_positive: This hotel felt like a standard nice accommodation. The staff were very kind, always willing to help if needed and I felt very safe/at home. The room itself had good air conditioning, a great shower with hot water and great pressure, a cozy bed and most importantly, the room was very soundproof so I was able to sleep with ease. The jacket closet was also very convenient, which allowed me to hang all my clothes like a regular home closet. Overall, for a solo traveller or a couple, this place is more than perfect. It really ticks all the boxes. Lastly, the pool is very relaxing and while the water is a bit cold, it's perfect for those hot Saigon days.
review.comment_negative: What I didn't like was that, upon checkout, I was told that they found makeup on one of the face towels and that I was required to pay for a new one, even though I contested that it could be washed. As well, when I had actively tried out the laundry service, nobody told me that my bill would be Â£30 for washing. If you are staying at this hotel, definitely be sure to keep the white towels perfectly white and don't bother with the laundry... too expensive.

review.comment_positive: nice hotel
review.comment_negative: came back to my room one day to find a note stating I needed to pay to wash a towel that was used and had apparently had a bit of dirt on it, was confused why I had to pay as they should wash the towels anyway but I paid without fuss, HOWEVER, within minutes of being informed about the towel the housekeeper was straight up with another bill for an alleged â€œmissingâ€ spoon, the spoon had fallen on the floor in the morning and I had forgotten to pick it off the floor before heading out for the day. I picked up the spoon and handed it to the housekeeper just absolutely confused why they were being so money grabbing, it was so off putting. my stay after this incident was a weird vibe to say the least. On checkout I was rushing to make a bus and reception wouldnâ€™t leave me leave the hotel until they checked the room, which fair enough, I waited 20 minutes at this point I had to leave as my taxi to the bus was outside. the housekeepers weâ€™re sending pictures of things in the room to reception, which I was confused about too. I informed them that I had to leave to make my bus and continued to my taxi, however the bell boy tried to stop me from leaving by speaking in Thai to the driver. I was a bit distraught after this and had to beg the driver to take me to my bus as I was going to miss it. it was the strangest check out experience of my life and because of this I would not recommend staying here. itâ€™s a lovely hotel but the staff unfortunately ruined my stay.

Eventually they moved us to another room on the same floor after two days,  after we complained multiple times. It was clear that the hotel staff knew that the room we had was a worse room because every staff member we mentioned it to knew immediately what we were talking about when we mentioned the room number. 

The staff were pretty unfriendly and even tried repeatedly to get us to delay getting into our taxi as we were rushing to leave in the morning to get to the airport (even though we told them we were in a rush to catch our flight) so they could check our room to look for things to charge us for. review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Deluxe GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i NhÃ¬n Ra ThÃ nh Phá»‘
review.comment_positive: The room was great. Clean and comfortable. The pool area was excellent. It is covered but open to the outside warmth. Fabulous breakfast every day with very good service. The Bellman Mr Phouc Nghia was very helpful and polite. I think they should make him concierge which the hotel doesnâ€™t have.
review.comment_negative: The hotel needs a concierge. We arrived off a 6.30am flight, exhausted, from Paris. Although the two ladies on the desk were doing their best, and were polite, it was clear that an early check-in was beyond their authority. We did eventually get into a room at 1.00pm - after waiting 5 or 6 hours. I realise the hotel was quite full but usually a hotel is able to do something to release a room a bit earlier. The restaurant is a bit odd. The breakfast is served on the ground floor. Dinner is served in your room or in the reception area. There is an upstairs dining room next to the pool but I donâ€™t think it was used. The biggest issue is no concierge to arrange tours, assist with advice on where things were and where to eat etc. We were supplied with 2 city maps which proved to be less than useful! One had the hotel shown in the wrong side of the road, and the other had the one way traffic going the wrong way! We got lost a lot! So my recommendation would be to promote Mr phouc to concierge with appropriate recompense and things could improve dramatically!

review.rating: 5 star hotel experience without the 5 star hotel price. Absolutely phenomenal in every way.
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Deluxe GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i NhÃ¬n Ra ThÃ nh Phá»‘
review.comment_positive: The location was phenomenal. I was less than a 5 min walk from Independence Palace, less than 10 min from the post office and other key tourist spots. I was less than 10 min from Diamond shopping center and right outside of the hotel was a cell phone carrier, so I purchased data quickly because I wanted an e-sim and the airport only had physical sims. To the right of the hotel, is a Jolibee and close by are plenty of convenience stores so that you can easily purchase snacks. Breakfast was delicious. It was obviously Vietnamese centered, but they had mini pancakes, cereal, and other Western comforts. I stuck with the Vietnamese foods despite being an American because I have allergies. The breakfast selection was also great because it wasnâ€™t the same every day which I appreciated.
review.comment_negative: I only received one room key. I was traveling solo, and I understand for safety and cost effectiveness, but I wish that I could have charged a few devices while I was sightseeing, but you needed your card to re-enter the room and to use the elevator. I could have left it and then asked them to let me in, but it wasnâ€™t worth it.

Overall, it was a very pleasant hotel to stay in.

review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Deluxe GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i NhÃ¬n Ra ThÃ nh Phá»‘
review.comment_positive: Room was clean, although smaller than expected. Check in was quick even though arrived late. Location was good. Close to centre.
review.comment_negative:
Pool area bar was closed permanently, not implied in advert. Gym was literally a bed room with a few weights in it. Breakfast sub par and towards end of breakfast slot felt like staff were trying to push us out. By far the worst was the accusations that a face cloth (!) was missing and the implication that we took it. Clearly had been picked up by accident when towels were collected in room clean. Part way during the stay when we had been at reception staff had almost threatened that if we couldnâ€™t find it by the end of the stay â€œthey would be having words with us.â€ On check out they held us while they did a room sweep, we had to emphasis we needed to leave for our flight, they then tried to charge us. We offered them to check out bags for said stolen face cloth. Ended up pushing back and effectively had to sign what was a makeshift affidavit saying we didnâ€™t steal it. Really hope
They donâ€™t hold that against cleaning staff and cut their wages for this - which seems likely based on the whole issue. Have since read other reviews saying that other guests were attempted to be charged for stained towels and dirty facecloths - seems bizarre considering the purpose of a face cloth is to clean dirt off your face. Ended up stressing out for most of our stay knowing we had this argument ahead of us with staff - over a face clothâ€¦â€¦

Over all put a very sour taste in the mouth. Aircon also wasnâ€™t working the first night so room was roasting. When we went down - another couple were staying the same. To be fair they fixed it quickly - but surely a regular faculties check of air con filters is standard procedure. Disappointing considering we paid extra for hotel for good service and faculties when in reality could have paid for much cheaper.

review.comment_positive:
I recently had the pleasure of staying at Orchids Hotel during my visit to the city, and I must say it was a truly exceptional experience from start to finish.

From the moment I stepped into the hotel, I was greeted by the warm and welcoming staff, whose friendliness and professionalism stood out throughout my entire stay. They went above and beyond to ensure that I felt comfortable and had everything I needed, making the check-in process seamless and stress-free.

The highlight of my stay was undoubtedly the spacious and impeccably clean room. The attention to detail in maintaining cleanliness was remarkable, and I felt reassured about the hotel's commitment to hygiene, especially in these times. The room was not only large but also thoughtfully designed, creating a cozy and inviting atmosphere. The bed was exceptionally comfortable, guaranteeing a restful night's sleep after a day of exploring the city.

One of the hotel's key strengths is its prime location in the city center. Being in the heart of the action allowed me to easily access popular attractions, restaurants, and shopping districts, making my overall experience even more enjoyable. Whether I was attending a business meeting or exploring the city's cultural gems, the hotel's central location was undeniably convenient.

The breakfast offered at the hotel was nothing short of excellent. The diverse spread catered to various tastes and dietary preferences, with fresh and high-quality ingredients. The attentive staff in the dining area ensured that tables were promptly cleared, and they were always ready to assist with any special requests.

In conclusion, my stay exceeded all expectations. The combination of friendly and professional staff, a spacious and clean room, a central location, and a delightful breakfast made it a memorable and enjoyable experience. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone seeking a top-notch accommodation experience in the heart of the city.

review.rating: it's an OK hotel with seemingly no intention to stand out.
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Deluxe GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i NhÃ¬n Ra ThÃ nh Phá»‘
review.comment_positive: The hotel is well located, within walking distance from everything we wanted to see in Ho Chi Minh city.
review.comment_negative:
The room was a little too small for our taste (I understand paying less gets you less of course). Having spent the last 2 days of our 2-week holiday, we found it's not really possible to really open both our suitcases in the room. What was disappointing is the pool: it is less spacious than in the pictures, but hey, you're in the city center so that's okay. However, there is no one at the pool bar -no music, no service of any kind. When you tell this to the front desk, they say you can order at the bar in the lobby -9 stories below the pool:)

The breakfast was also not something we really liked but to be fair, by this point we wanted to eat western stuff, so the selection of Vietnam breakfast might have been better. The coffee was downright bad though in any standard (even worse knowing how great coffee Vietnam has).

The last and final experience we had was the minibar bill: when paying the bill, it turned out that the amounts in the menu in the room were not inclusive of tax, so whatever you pay is approx. 17% more. This is nothing brutal since there are only soft drinks and water available but for me, it's really about the principle: why would you present the price for food and drinks without tax? This is not at all customary in the country, we have not experienced this anywhere else. Again, it is not about the amount, but the fact that this is literally the last experience you get that will stay with you.

review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Deluxe GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i NhÃ¬n Ra ThÃ nh Phá»‘
review.comment_positive:
The location was good for walking to the Independence Palace, and it is close to Saigon Zoo (great for our 4 year old). The food available in house was good and the breakfast had plenty of options from western (eggs, pancakes, toast) and asian (noodles, salad). The breakfast options changed daily and despite the busy breakfast mornings there was always plenty of food in the buffet. Great restaurant in walking distance, Pizza & Bia. 
Airport transfers are organised by the hotel. The hotel room was lovely and quiet. The staff were very friendly especially to our little one. The swimming pool area had only a few seats but we were never left without at least one being available to us.
review.comment_negative: The towels next to the pool would regularly be gone and not checked on for a while. The bathroom had a window that looked into the bedroom which is not great when you are staying with your family. There was a blind that we could pull down. There was also a full length window next to the toilet which again we kept the blind down for the time we were there.

review.comment_positive: Property is in a good location with most sights within 15 minute walk and plenty of restaurants nearby.
review.comment_negative:
We deliberately booked a room with a window only to find it looked straight into a next door concrete wall. This was obviously disappointing. We did ask for a move recognising that this might be difficult. but perhaps even more disappointing was the lack of interest of reception staff advising us that we had the type of room we booked so nothing could be done.

It was also disappointing that the cafe/bar in the pool area was closed.

Carpeting needs refurbishment.

review.comment_positive:
This was the last place we stayed while visiting Vietnam and easily one of the best hotels.
It was extremely clean, rooftop pool was great, very comfortable beds and Netflix on the tv to use. Location is quiet at night time from the 8th floor and beautiful view from the room. Neighborhood is very safe and a short walk to eateries.
On check out we asked to store our stuff all day which was no problem and they even let us use the pool and gym shower on the last day as our flight didn't leave until 11pm.
About 150000 dong from the airport.

Our air-conditioning wasn't overly cold even on 16 degrees but we slept through with no problems.
